Class Board

Graphical User Interface for a Board used in the teaching of UW's 100 level CS, and MacLachlan's ICS4U courses.

Author: Kirill Levin, Troy Vasiga, Chris Ingram

Edited by: Saad Koker, Rory Keogh


             

Constructor Summary
Board(int cols)
          The constructor to build a one-dimensional board: One row and N columns.
Board(int cols, String windowName)
          The constructor to build a one-dimensional board: One row and N columns, with a custom window title.
Board(int rows, int cols)
          The constructor to build a two-dimensional board.
Board(int rows, int cols, String windowName)
          The constructor to build a two-dimensional board with a custom window title.
 
Method Summary
 void displayMessage(String theMessage)
          Sets the message to be displayed under the board.
 void displayMessage(String theMessage, String textColor)
          Sets the message to be displayed under the board, as well as the color of the message.
 void displayMessage(String theMessage, Color textColor)
          Sets the message to be displayed under the board, as well as the color of the message.
 void changeBoardColor(String colorNameA, String colorNameB)
          Changes the color of the board during runtime using preset colors.
 void changeBoardColor(Color colorNameA, Color colorNameB)
          Changes the color of the board during runtime using provided colors.
 void texturePack(String texturePack, int duration)
          Changes the color theme of the board.
 int getColumns()
           Returns the number of columns of the board.
 int getKeyStroke()
          Returns keyboard input.
 int getClick()
          Returns a Coordinate object with the row and column of the square clicked.
 int getPosition()
          Like getClick(), but for one-dimensional boards.
 int getRows()
           Returns the number of rows of the board.
 void putPeg(String theColour, int col)
          Places a coloured gamepiece in the designated square on the board (used in one-dimensional boards).
 void removePeg(int col)
          Removes any gamepiece on the designated square, if one exists.
 void removePeg(int row, int col)
          Removes any gamepiece on the designated square, if one exists.
 void vibrate(int shakeLength, int shakeIntensity)
          Translates the application window to create a vibration/shake effect

Constructor Detail

Board

public Board(int cols)
The constructor to build a one-dimensional board: One row and N columns.

Parameters:
cols - The number of columns on the board

Board

public Board(int cols,
             String windowName)
The constructor to build a two-dimensional board.

Parameters:
rows - The number of rows on the board
windowName - The name of the application

Board

public Board(int rows,
             int cols)
The constructor to build a two-dimensional board.

Parameters:
rows - The number of rows on the board
cols - The number of columns on the board

Board

public Board(int rows,
             int cols, String windowName)
The constructor to build a two-dimensional board.

Parameters:
rows - The number of rows on the board
cols - The number of columns on the board
windowName - The name of the application
Method Detail

displayMessage

public void displayMessage(String theMessage)
Sets the message to be displayed under the board. This message is printed below the board and can be updated.

Parameters:
theMessage - The text message to be displayed below the board.

displayMessage

public void displayMessage(String theMessage, String textColor)
Sets the message to be displayed under the board. This message is printed below the board and can be updated.

Parameters:
theMessage - The text message to be displayed below the board.
textColor - the color of the text message displayed. Possible values are "yellow", "blue", "cyan", "green", "pink", "black", "white", "red" and "orange"

displayMessage

public void displayMessage(String theMessage, Color textColor)
Sets the message to be displayed under the board. This message is printed below the board and can be updated.

Parameters:
theMessage - The text message to be displayed below the board.
textColor - the color of the text message displayed. Ex. (36, 45, 78)

putPeg

public void putPeg(String theColour,
                   int row,
                   int col)
Places a coloured gamepiece in the designated square on the board.

Parameters:
theColour - The colour of the gamepiece. Possible values are "yellow", "blue", "cyan", "green", "pink", "black", "white", "red" and "orange"
row - The row on which to place the the gamepiece
col - The column on which to place the gamepiece

putPeg

public void putPeg(Color theColour,
                   int row,
                   int col)
Places a coloured gamepiece in the designated square on the board.

Parameters:
theColour - The colour of the gamepiece. Values are any color in the sRGB space.
row - The row on which to place the the gamepiece
col - The column on which to place the gamepiece

putPeg

public void putPeg(String theColour,
                   int col)
Places a coloured gamepiece in the designated square on the board (used in one-dimensional boards). This gamepiece replaces any gamepiece already on that square.

Parameters:
theColour - The colour of the gamepiece. Possible values are "yellow", "blue", "cyan", "green", "pink", "black", "white", "red" and "orange"
col - The column on which to place the gamepiece

removePeg

public void removePeg(int row,
                      int col)
Removes any gamepiece on the designated square, if one exists.

Parameters:
row - The row of the gamepiece to remove
col - The column of the gamepiece to remove

removePeg

public void removePeg(int col)
Removes any gamepiece on the designated square, if one exists.

Parameters:
col - The column of the gamepiece to remove

getClick

public Coordinate getClick()
Accepts input from the user. When called, this method waits for user to click somewhere on the board and then returns the location of the click.

Returns:
A Coordinate object with the row and column of the square clicked.

getPosition

public int getPosition()
Like getClick(), but for one-dimensional boards. Accepts input from the user. When called, this method waits for user to click somewhere on the board and then returns the location of the click.

Returns:
The column of the square clicked.

getKeyStroke()

public int getKeyStroke()
Returns the keycode of a users keyboard click.

Returns:
The keycode of a users keyboard click.

getColumns

public int getColumns()
Returns the number of columns of the board

Returns:
The number of columns of the board.

getRows

public int getRows()
Returns the number of rows of the board

Returns:
The number of rows of the board.
